issue.title: Update our docstrings for PEP 257

repository.name: google-cloud-python
repository.description: Google Cloud Client Library for Python

issue.body: PyLint has added checks to more closely follow [PEP 257](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) which caused linting to fail. We should update our docstrings so we can revert  #1967.

issue.title: Disable pylint 1.6 warnings / work around breakage

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: This human has signed the Contributor License Agreement.

repository.name: google-cloud-python
repository.description: Google Cloud Client Library for Python

issue.body:
Work around https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/998

Globally disable new warnings (rather than just for tests, as in #1967).

Run pylint a single file at a time:  if any exits with a non-zero status, record the name and status and continue (this helped debug the issue above).

body: Thank you. Adding this for the next patch release, which should be due by next week (probably the fix will land faster!).

@AWhetter can you cherry-pick this fix into 1.6, so we could have a release
with it?
On Jul 13, 2016 9:39 PM, "Ashley Whetter" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Closed #998 https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/998 via caa8935
> https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/commit/caa89359ad9ce957f54d3ae144cca5c5e78a3a33
> .
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/998#event-722147450, or mute the
> thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AAbWprsA27gQzn7xe5--o7k1vuA7tt2Nks5qVU0QgaJpZM4JJzTp
> .
@tseaver This fix should now be available in Pylint 1.6.2, freshly released.

@PCManticore The fix for `gcloud.streaming.http_wrapper` is indeed in that release.  Thank you!

The `gcloud.bigtable.happybase.connection` issue still exists.  To reproduce:

``` bash
$ git clone --depth=1 https://GoogleCloudPlatform/gcloud-python
$ cd gcloud-python
$ sed -ie "s/os\.path\.join('gcloud.*connection/# &/" scripts/run_pylint.py
$ tox -e lint
```

Note that the failure does not occur when running `pylint` only against `gcloud/bigtable/happybase/connection.py`.
Oh, my mistake, I thought they are the same. Looking into it.
Of course, paths may vary with my example.
I just released 1.6.3, this should be fixed there. Let me know how it works for you.

issue.title: Pylint 1.6.3 compatibility

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: This human has signed the Contributor License Agreement.

repository.name: google-cloud-python
repository.description: Google Cloud Client Library for Python

issue.body: Fixes in [pylint 1.6.2 and 1.6.3](https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/998) mean we can test the files that caused it to barf in 1.6.0.

body: @PCManticore Thanks, that does fix it for [gcloud-python](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/gcloud-python/pull/1990).
